result.execSummary:
The defendant Alan D. Pichotta was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Alan D. Pichotta is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Alan D. Pichotta was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction

supervisions.notes: Huber and good time allowed - eligible for community service under 973.03(3).

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Defendant Alan D. Pichotta in court with attorney Gary S. Cirilli.  Defendant Alan D. Pichotta in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 3:34 PM. Cirilli - here for PLEAS on both matters - provides court with plea questionnaire. State - have complied with victim notification requirements and she is in teh courtroom today  - plead to counts #1 and #2 on 15CM149 and plead to amended count #1 of misd bail jumping contrary to 946.49(1)(a) on 16CF57  - 120 days in FC jail, court costs, dismiss count #1; dismiss counts #3 and #4 on 15CF149; for counts #1 and #2 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 12 months probation with conditions of: $500 fine plus costs on count #1 as domestic, #2 - court costs only, AODA and follow thru, anger management with follow thru, restitution as submitted today by State (Amended) - $7358.21  plus VW surcharge of $735.82 for a total restitution amount of $8094.03, maintain absolute sobriety, no possession of alcohol and no entry into any taverns, bars or similar establishments, 100 hours of community service, no contact with victim. Cirilli and Pichotta agree - 5 days of jail credit on 15CF149 and 2 days of jail credit on 16CF57 and has $1500.00 posted total between the two cases. Court - 15CF149 - court dismisses counts #3 and #4. Pichotta pleads G to count #1 as alleged and NC to count #2 as alleged. Court - 165CF57 - court amends count #2 of misd bail jumping contrary to 946.49(1)(a) - reads new charge and penalty, court dismisses count #1. Pichotta pleads NC to count #2 as amended. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Cirilli makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Pichotta makes statement, remorseful. Victim makes statement. Court sentences the defendant to the following: 16CF57 - count #2 - 120 days in FC jail - huber and good time allowed - report today - eligible for community service under 93.03(3) - 2 days credit (stipulated) - report today, costs - take bond posted and remainder put on 15CF149; on 15CF149 - counts #1 and #2, withhold sentence and place on probation for 1 year  - concurrent to jail time on 16CF57 - with conditions of: AODA and follow thru, anger management with follow thru, $500.00 plus costs on count #1 - paid thru probation, costs only on count #2 - paid thru probation, no consumption or possession of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, 100 hours of community service, no contact with victim (DP), restitution the amount of $8094.03 (stipulated amount) - take bond posted and remainder due thru probation, submit DNA sample with expunction rights given, credit for 5 days only if revoked, right to appeal, adjourned.
No consumption of alcohol. No contact with Katherine Carpenter.
